item.title: Role-Based Access Control
item.description: This section provides information about how access control works for Apache Polaris (Incubating). Polaris uses a role-based access control (RBAC) model in which the Polaris administrator assigns access privileges to catalog roles and then grants access to resources to principals by assigning catalog roles to principal roles. These are the key concepts to understanding access control in Polaris: Securable object Principal role Catalog role Privilege Securable object A securable object is an object to which access can be granted.
